website_summaries.verdict: A workhorse external drive for the Mac with a long history of performance and reliability.
pros: Advanced encryption capabilities make it easy to protect files from unwanted access
Large body is durable and pleasing to the eye when sitting on a desktop
cons: Too large to be used comfortably as a portable external hard drive for laptops

customer_reviews.title: Does not pass WD diagnostic tests out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: Just got it this afternoon. I have learned from bad experience that it is critical to test hard drives when you get them. I ran the WD Diagnostics and it hangs at 10%. I then ran WD Lifeguard short test, and it failed that test, with error Checkpoint =97 did not complete smart test. However, the smart test by itself is OK. My computer also rebooted doing these tests. Will do some further tests and I contacted WD, but looks like this is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Howard A.

customer_reviews.title: Software does not work.  Tech Support unintelligble - UNABLE to Backup
customer_reviews.text: Using Win 10 on new SSD, WD My Book Backup SW does not work. WD My Book HW recognized by CPU, could manually copy files, but unable to do full backup. WD Backup SW could "not find device" REPEATEDLY, even w/ tech "support". 2 hours on the phone w/ 3 different WD support techs with such strong Indian accents that they were unintelligible. 2 levels of tech engineers & they could not fix it even with remote access. Multiple WD SW installs, uninstalls, reinstalls = terrible SW & Support
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Sue

customer_reviews.title: Annoying vibration unacceptable for home office.
customer_reviews.text: I can hear and feel a loud and very annoying low pitched vibration from this 8TB WD My Book drive as it sits (vertically) on my desk. It's not subtle but very noticeable. I have owned several external 3.5" USB hard disks in the past and this My Book is unacceptable. I sent it back for a refund and will be searching for a better alternative. Update: I just received my Western Digital 8TB EASYSTORE EXTERNAL HDD (WDBCKA0080HBK-NESN) that costs more and is rumored to use higher quality WD Red NAS drives. The EASYSTORE is also sitting on my desk vertically and it is whisper quiet. For me the WD EASYSTORE is well worth the additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Abester

customer_reviews.title: ... little over 3 months and the drive has gone bad. 10-15 days for replacement with all data lost ...
customer_reviews.text: A little over 3 months and the drive has gone bad. 10-15 days for replacement with all data lost because Asurian insurance bought thru Amazon wants it go thru Western Digital since in the first year. Customer Service for both Western Digital and Asurian let this customer down. No more wasted $$ on insurance.
customer_reviews.author: D Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What?  I can't hear you over my HDD.
customer_reviews.text: I have been holding off on writing this review for a while but it's time. I bought this POC for $230 and the price has been dropping like a rock since...why?...because it is literally as loud as a garbage disposal. It is so loud I have to have my backups run overnight because I can’t stand being in the same room as this hard drive while it backs up. The only bright side is that the noise from the pool pump running right outside my window no longer bothers me because I can’t hear it over my WD 8TB HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Ld

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Inside is WD80EZZX. 5400rpm Helium drive. From my performance benchmarks it looks like a PMR drive rather than SMR one (e.g. Seagate).
customer_reviews.author: allanlee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these drives, one is for backup. When I turn my computer on it takes them about 5-10 minutes to show up on my iMac's Finder. Sometimes one of them will just disappear from Finder. I've had them less than 2 months and fear that they both are going to fail with all my data. I've used WD products before and have been very happy. However, buying this version WD 4 TB My Book Desktop External Hard Drive was a huge and expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: I Love Western Digital Products!!
customer_reviews.text: I truly believe Western Digital drives are one of the best drives ever made! I have 4 Western Digital drives, for several years now. They last a really long time. I don't understand what "noise," some people were complaining about. My new 10TB drive is very quiet. I barely hear it! People need to stop over reacting. Also, despite not having lights on the drive, it's not a big deal. You can see what's going on on your computer screen. Get over it, and move on b*tches.
customer_reviews.author: Sepia Photographi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed all the way around
customer_reviews.text: I have 14 of the WD 4TB external drives and love them. This 8TB drive is slow and very LOUD. Quite disappointing. Also disappointing is paying to be a Prime member and being told I will get 2-day delivery. It took 6 days to get this drive delivered.
customer_reviews.author: fosta

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Slow!
customer_reviews.text: Man what a horribly slow drive! Thankfully I'm using for strict storage and backup, otherwise I'd go crazy attempting to access information. It took 4 hours to add 300 GB's of movies from an Extreme Sandisk that is fast in its own right. I also had a bad experience transferring info from one of the fastest SSD drives on the planet as peak speed topped out at 40 MB/s. [UPDATE_06-29-2019] No it took 6 hours to transfer the 300 GB's of movies at a snail's clip of 20 MB/s and less.
customer_reviews.author: George Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works on Samsung Smart TV!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to backup my enormous personal library of videos and was first concerned because it wasn't working properly on my Samsung Smart TV 75". The initial format is ExFat. Fat32 is out of the question for this enormous 8tb external hard drive. So I took a leap of faith and restarted the process and instead reformatted it using NTFS. Presto!!! Works like a charm!!! So if you have a Samsung Smart TV, be sure to format your 8tb external using NTFS otherwise ExFat won't work. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Aku

customer_reviews.title: Used Units, Beware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this new hard drive. I paid for a new sealed Hard drive. Received a used beat up hard drive with no padding in the plain cardboard box! No original product box, it was just in a generic cardboard box without any sort of padding. I Guess that's a broken spindle that's rattling ? I'm not happy.
customer_reviews.author: lifeisjustblah_

customer_reviews.title: Survived a bad throw!
customer_reviews.text: Mine survived a terrible delivery guy (recorded and reported) with only the basic product box so that speaks for build quality and packaging for sure. But they really should've shipped it in an Amazon box with padding. Not sure if the speed is relevant but it seems to be really fast, 75GB transfer took about 8 min. So far so good. Update: 2nd day, stuck on unlock window with the loading wheel of death. Fixed by disconnecting from USB hub and connect it directly to the computer. If that doesn't work, download the WD drive utilities diagnostic app. It will prompt you to unlock the drive in a separate window which I found more responsive than the first unlock box.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Macintosh w/ High Sierra Format Note
customer_reviews.text: Macintosh owners with High Sierra, you may find yourself frustrated with an "operation failed" error in Disk Utility when you attempt to reformat for Mac. Search the WD Support area for "macOS Disk Utility Error Media Kit Reports Not Enough Space..." which is answer ID 20789. The fix is easy. However, fixes offered elsewhere on the internet are downright byzantine. Stick with the WD support file. (PS: WD notes the error may also occur for Sierra and El Capitan.)
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: WD 10TB My Book Desktop External Hard Drive, USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: A file backup hard drive made for desktops. Not made to be highly portable as in the smaller, pocket-sized versions; it's made as a book-sized appliance that sits next to your desktop computer. Under normal use, these "My Books," last about 5 years without experiencing a problem, unless your room's electrical setup keeps experiencing power dropouts and brownouts. I chose the 10TB capacity since I have to back up hundreds of movie videos, thousands of pieces of music, and tens of thousands of digital photography images I've taken and collected over the past 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: sierrawren

customer_reviews.title: Striped out of the box, this does NOT contain 2 8TB drives.
customer_reviews.text: Be advised these are STRIPED out of the box, so the 8TB is actually 2x4TB drives. Considering it's the price of 2x8TB single drive enclosures I made the mistake of thinking it was 2x8TB. It should be very clearly stated the number and size of the drives inside, horrible packaging description and a huge waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty much plug&play
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty much plug&play, with the exception if the formatting. Computer recognized it immediately, but my Acronis recovery disk would not, so it was impossible to recover backups. Once I determined that the bloody thing came formatted as xFat instead of NTFS, and got it formatted correctly, it works perfectly. Would give five stars if it had an "activity" light so one could tell when it was on, and/or working, and it came properly formatted.
customer_reviews.author: jetjock

customer_reviews.title: Thou shalt backup thy data!
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard backup products that runs in the background while you're working. Even solid state drives (SSD) fail eventually, so always back up your data, especially photos, tax returns, and critical files. Or that design project done on a CAD/EDA system that you've invested several weeks in. You get the picture. One issue: When I had the wireless transceiver and the hard drive on adjacent ports and probably the same USB controller, my keyboard would periodically lose communications with my computer. I'm not sure if this was a bandwidth or power issue but relocating the wireless hub to a different USB port solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Circuit Hacker

customer_reviews.title: How not to ship a spinning disk drive...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe shipping materials are in short supply, maybe there was a rush to get the product out quickly, maybe that was simply the only box they had. These are understandably difficult times, and people are out there trying to make things work. But let's be real, there isn't a place in 2020 for something like this. Even with an enclosure, the standard spinning platter HDD isn't designed to be knocked around excessively. Packing peanuts, inflatable bags, cat litter, pencil shavings, lawn clippings, at least something to keep things stable during shipping would have been great. At least I bought the warranty.  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Alcaraz

customer_reviews.title: Great HD, but not if used with the Sabrent Hub
customer_reviews.text: As expected the WD 6TB external HD arrived as promised. Based on the Amazon website heading "Frequently Bought Together," I also purchased the Sabrent 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UM43). After multiple attempts, I was unable to setup the HD, while connecting it through the Sabrent Hub. Upon checking the WD website, I learned that the Sabrent can not be used with the WD. After connecting the HD directly to my computer, it works great. Don't know who is responsible (Amazon, Western Digital or Sabrent) for "suggesting" that they would work together, but someone needs to take responsibility and correct the problem!
customer_reviews.author: brhoff

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE NEW WD EXTERNAL HARD DRIVES, THEY WILL CRASH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used WD hard drives for YEARS as a professional photographer and have literally dozens of them with zero problems with any of them. Purchased 2 more, and they haven't sounded right since day one-my gut told me to ditch them, I didn't listen, and now 4 TB of data on 2 drives are totally GONE. Yes, I back up, but the headache to retrieve all backups is a NIGHTMARE! Apparently this is a known issue, WD needs to recall these pieces of crap, they are horrible!!
customer_reviews.author: Maltymom

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage, ok for home use
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent unit. It does its job, but I don't like that it has a noise it makes while it's idling. I have it hooked up to my Xbox and sometimes even if the Xbox is off, I'll be trying to have breakfast and watch TV and I just hear it cranking. It's not loud, but loud enough to be annoying. I'm sure in like a year the 8TB hard drives will be using some new hardware that doesn't have this problem, so maybe wait for that if noise is a concern or go down to the 4TB. I have the 4TB MyBook and it does not produce any noise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Seagate drives for years but have decided to try WD after so many Seagate failures. Will update the review if I have an early failure but so far the drive works as it should. Well, except that it's noisy sometimes, like surprisingly noisy, but as long as it works reliably I can handle the rumbling/grinding noisy. It's a good looking, unassuming, little black box that doesn't try to call attention to itself on my desk. I'm using it on a linux (ubuntu) system, using gnu parted for partitioning. Happy to see that it spins down after inactivity to save power.
customer_reviews.author: Martin E

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week of use!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! I installed the drive and one week later, the disc became corrupt, preventing me from copying any new files onto the drive. I tried several different methods to fix the bad sectors, but was unsuccessful. I have since returned the product to Amazon and bought a (gulp) Seagate Expansion drive instead. I have not had luck with Seagate drives lasting longer than 3-4 years, but at least that's better than 1 week!!! Perhaps my experience isn't the norm, but my advice is make sure any files you copy on a hard drive are backed up elsewhere as well (thankfully that was the case with me).
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Joe

customer_reviews.title: Mine has WD80EZAZ inside. It is Ultrastar He10-8 SATA ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine has WD80EZAZ inside. It is Ultrastar He10-8 SATA. This Drive has 3.3V reset function. If you plan to install this HDD inside PC, please use modified power plug with removed 3.3v wire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WD80EZAZ's inside
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for the purpose of shucking. Shucking them was somewhat difficult but all 3 enclosures had WD80EZAZ's inside. These drives conform to the SATA 3.3 standard so you need to either cover pin 3 with some special tape, or use Molex to SATA power adapters so that they'll work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Brand new MyBook sold and shipped from Amazon.com Services LLC. Just arrive. First time use. No showing drive letter after connecting to PC. Found in windows 10 Disk Management. Showing as Unknown Disk. Not Initialized. When I try to initialize it, showing "The device is not ready" or "The request could not be performed because of an I/O device error." I have tried different port, different OS, different computers and none of those work. After contacting WD support, the technique agent told me it's no longer functional. I am very disappointed about the fact. Waiting for the replacement coming. I will update review when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Insecure using this to store photos and video
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Bought 16tb My Book Duo in February and 6 months later ic very little use I am experiencing raid degraded issues daily. I rebuild and minutes later the amber light is flashing again. Very disconcerting since I Store photo and video. I have some ic it backed up but not all yet. I have run all diagnostics but nothing shows up. I guess it is just a matter of time before the whole thing fails.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: All of these WD external drives run too hot
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased 3 of these WD external hard drives in the last 2 months, I have noticed that they all run hotter than what is considered normal. Average temperature of the drive in a 74 degree (F) environment will be 116 degrees or higher (when not in use), and will climb to over 122-125 degrees when in use. I deem this too hot to withstand long-term use, therefore I returned all 3 drives for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1st was defective upon setup,  replacement works fine
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this....1st one I received would power cycle on it's own every 50 seconds (connect, show up in windows, start a transfer, disconnect/ disappear - it had turned itself off)... Amazon customer service was excellent as always, and the second one I received had worked flawlessly (so far, a week). I don't have a lot of confidence since my first was defective...... So 3 stars.... Update: I wanted to note that I tried multiple computers, and tried running the western digital diagnostic application, but it would not work, since the drive shut down....
customer_reviews.author: Ogre Ray

customer_reviews.title: It’s actually only 5.75 TB
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually only 5.75 TB, and the data transfer speed is a little slow - it maxes out around 36 MB/s ...but that’s good enough for now. This is my second “my book”. The first one is still alive and well after 4 years - but it’s filled to capacity, so I decided to get another. I love these Hdds, they’re so efficient and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Do Yourself a Favor, Buy Another Brand
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a lower rating than one star, but Amazon doesn't offer a lower rating. I've had problems in the past with Western Digital products (on a Mac). I spent 35 minutes on the phone trying to trouble-shoot this drive. Customer service was dense as dense can be. Didn't help and in the end gave me an RMA number to ship it back. Lousy product. Lousy customer service. AVOID WESTERN DIGITAL AT ALL COSTS.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Rotbart

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, and quality except power supply
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these a yr ago, and really love them, I needed more and went back to same suppler . I am happy, Reason for 4 star, is the power supply is the weak link. I bought new power supplies made for security cameras, the are not made in Cambodia. I had a problem with one drive a month ago, and thought it was bad, I had spare power supplies and just used one on it and the problem was solved. So if you order new $12 5 am power supplies from China you will be happy with these 6tb drives.
customer_reviews.author: Gina McGlothin

customer_reviews.title: Nearly an entire TB missing. Not Cool.
customer_reviews.text: Two stars for the simple fact that it only comes with 7.1TB. Now I understand that no flashdrive or external drive or internal drives comes with exactly what you see on the box and that it is an estimated storage. But almost an entire TB? That to me is ridiculous. It should at least be able to be rounded to the nearest number. Meaning if I buy an 8TB I should be able to expect 7.5 or 7.6 or so TB. 7.1 is ridiculous, just list this as a 7TB hardrive.
customer_reviews.author: wgs123

customer_reviews.title: Bought February - Failed in July - Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: I used it three times. Once to save my files from school, photos, etc. Twice to copy a few files. Now it doesn't work. Disk recovery returns failures. Tried to reformat it but only returns errors and prompts to "backup your data". Note : I'm a IT person for work. I know all the various ways to prolong, protect, and maintain hard drives. This kind of failure is absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bieber

customer_reviews.title: Why is it vertical and easy to tip over??
customer_reviews.text: I can't understand why they make this hard drive designed to operate vertically. It is sooo top heavy and easy to tip over. It's supposedly not safe to operate it horizontally, but if you operate it vertically you have to be insanely careful or you will knock it over all the time. What I don't understand is why do they keep making hard drives like this? Don't we know it's a mistake already? I've had mine for a year and a half and am basically happy other than this one thing. I did have to replace the power adapter recently. It's got good capacity and so far hasn't failed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: 8 TB Drive is a waste of money and time - DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive as a replacement for a failed backup drive (the drive appears to be OK, but the USB interface failed). This new drive hangs my system when attempting a large file transfer. I attempted to reset the problem by reformatting the drive, but the reformatting operation also hangs after ~15 minutes. This was a total waste of money and the time to troubleshoot. This is my first outright failure of a brand new drive. I am requesting a full refund. In the future, I will stay clear of using Western Digital drives. VERY DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.author: Angus in Hawai'i

customer_reviews.title: It is really 9.09 GB large
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive is a-okay, but the advertised sizes isn't real. It's really almost 10% smaller. I reformatted the drive to NTFS from a FAT formatted drive. It took close to 15-18 hours to reformat, but when it was done...the space on the drive 9.09 TB as usable space. The bytes displays as 10,000,829,247,488 bytes...which is 10 TB. Not 100% sure why more of the drive isn't accessible. Everything else seems to be in line...I would purchase again, but virtually 1 TB not being available is kind of sad.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Matthew S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one year; I am no longer a fan of Western Digital
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a big fan of Western Digital going back to the 1980s, but no more. Lately I’ve had three hard drive failures and now this Western Digital 12TB My Book Duo doesn’t work. It started a couple months back when the fan (quite loud) started endlessly running for no apparent reason. I made sure the firmware was up-to-date, and just today it dismounted itself from my Mac (during a backup) and the fan went on (I had to unplug it). I just wasted $400 by buying this expensive piece of cr_p. Guaranteed, I am never going to buy another Western Digital product again. I will make a habit of choosing from more expensive LaCie product line.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: countless hours to realize this drive does not work on my Mac running Catalina
customer_reviews.text: as subject says, drive fails to wake up at some point continually and I have to reboot to mount the drive again. The Western Digital sleep time is off so it should sync with the system sleep timer. I can open the drive but no files show up until I restart my computer. This is the replacement drive. Same issue on the first one as well. Have to find another drive that is Mac compatible for sure cause I've spent at least 10 hours trying to make this work. My rating is based on my personal experience with this drive. Seems decent otherwise...
customer_reviews.author: Greg Killmaster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Happy with this so far.
customer_reviews.text: Review for WD 6TB My Book Duo Desktop RAID External Hard Drive - USB 3.1 - WDBFBE0060JBK-NESN. This seems pretty good so far. I'm halfway through testing both drives in single mode via HDDScan and so far so good. If it fails you will see updating this review. The WD Utility software for this made setting the RAID mode a breeze and its easy to install and is very user friendly. It wasn't really packed very well in the Amazon package box but the original product box seems have done a good job protecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Lantern

customer_reviews.title: BUY 2 AND USE ONE FOR A BACK OF THE FIRST
customer_reviews.text: Failed just after the 3 year warranty expired. With so many reliability problems listed on Amazon, it seems logical to buy a second one to backup the first one and run them both at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The worst drive ever
customer_reviews.text: This think is a complete pain in the butt to use. You have to use WD software to access it and then after three days of moving files to it. It FAILS. JUNK JUNK JUNK! Just take your money and buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: AbeScot

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with all routers.
customer_reviews.text: Netgear routers support use of Seagate routers, but not WD (assuming you want to connect it directly to your router for use as a home network resource). You might not be able to use the USB connections in this way. Check this out with your router manufacturer before deciding to buy this. It does work well when connected directly to a Windows 10 computer, but obviously can't be used on a home network if the computer it's attached to is off or asleep. It's very quiet
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMatthew

customer_reviews.title: This is the toughest external drive I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is one tough work-horse! I’ve had it a while now, moved twice, put it in a box for a year, dug it out recently and everything is just as it was. No lost information or sector errors that keep it from opening files. Great product if you have a lot of video files to store. Overall, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Grady Glover

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully the pictures they provide give you a good idea for the size and it’s not too big. I really didn’t care how physically big it would be, but I was surprised by the size; it was honestly smaller than I thought it would be. I use it for my xbox since I am a xbox game pass user and EA pass user it definitely has more space than anyone could ever use. I have close to 100+ games downloaded that are everywhere from 100gb to 8gb. PLUS I don’t have to delete a single game when I update COD: Modern Warfare.
customer_reviews.author: Jane/John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Dependable large capacity drives!
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital is my trusted manufacturer for traditional spinning-disk hard-drives. Recently, I added some storage space to a couple of my computers, and that meant I needed to get backup drives which could handle larger amounts of data (audio, video, etc...). These drives came securely packed, the instructions were easy to follow, they powered on and connected quickly and they've been running smoothly and quietly since the day I turned them on. WD has an excellent warranty policy on these drives (also a plus!) and has provided exceptional customer service for me in the past, so I have no doubt that if they don't live out their normal lifetime, WD will be there to make things right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O. Sims

customer_reviews.title: This will fail and wipe all your stuff within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these and have been very happy and over the last 6 months, each one has failed and all data is lost. These things have a shelf live so they're great if you only need them for a few years. Otherwise, back it all up on another disk somewhere or buy something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: aaron schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage for a Small Price
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, the jury is still out of whether I like WD or Seagate drives better. To be honest, they both work great and seem to last up to when the next tier of technology is here to replace it. In this case, the price was right for the large amount of storage. It's working well right out of the box. I do have ONE complaint... It's a small one. Why are there no more operating LEDs on this device. I understand that a single LED will drive up the price of the box, but come on! It's nice to know, at a glance, that there is access to your external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Spinnazola

customer_reviews.title: Useless - endless repetition of message "Installation failed. Please retry later."
customer_reviews.text: No sign of a manual, but plug'n'play probably shouldn't require one. However during the installation process which is (i) download (ii) extract and (iii) install, it ran through (i) and (ii) perfectly but stalled 45% of the way through (iii) with no diagnostics, simply a message reading "Installation failed. Please retry later." Four doses of this (always at the 45% installed point) was enough for me. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Delta D.

customer_reviews.title: Using as a Time Machine drive with macOS
customer_reviews.text: I have this 6TB HD hooked up to an iMac running Mojave. It's used exclusively for Time Machine backups. The drive has been working reliably over the several months since I bought it. Something to keep in mind before purchasing is that the drive enclosure does not have a status light. Consequently, there isn't any visual way to tell if the drive is reading, writing, idle, or disconnected. Four stars.
customer_reviews.author: korova

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow when transferring data
customer_reviews.text: I have had several MyBook Duo drives and they have all been fast and reliable. This one is the 8TB version. Configured in Raid 1 for mirroring the drives and connected via USB C. Transferring 293GB of RAW camera files is estimated at 2 days, which is ridiculous, I tested the old Firewire 800 version and it will take around 40 minutes for the same files. After contacting WD support they simply told me to return it and get another one, but I feel this issue may be related to the new cost reducing plan WD has in place to use Shingled drives in these devices. Overall I would recommend steering clear of this product line moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: GB in merica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: For the money you cant go wrong with this hard-drive! I use it for my Xbox One S. Before I got this hard-drive my 500GB Xbox was sitting at 90 percent full. Now my Xbox's memory is a 5% and with everything I had on my Xbox this hard-drive is only at 7% full. I noticed a slight improvement in my load times for game as well. It is nice looking and compliments my gaming area. The Xbox One immediately recognized the drive as soon as I plugged it in and transferring files was super easy and much fast than downloading to the Xbox initially was.
customer_reviews.author: GrimmRoper

customer_reviews.title: It's what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Easy to plug and play. Recommend always using the "safely remove device" feature or you will get an error message saying there is a problem with the device through Windows even though there isn't. I am using this as a backup device for the WD MyCloud networked external drives I already have. It works on my Samsung smart TV also. Does not work with Windows XP, but I am able to use it on later versions of Windows ( 7 and up).
customer_reviews.author: Jhess Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way to Backup my FreeNAS Data and Photos!!!
customer_reviews.text: Make the DUO a JBOD with the Windows MyBook Utility. Attached the WD USB 3.1 in ESXi on my FreeNAS VM(ESXi). Then I could both the JBOD 4TB Drives were addressable in FreeNAS! Made mirrored drive Pool and a storage Dataset. Setup replication between the WD Drive Dataset and my other FreeNas Dataset. If there is a emergency, I told my wife to grab just this black box and get out! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ethan N Austin

customer_reviews.title: Product seems good, time will tell.  SHIPPING SUCKED
customer_reviews.text: Amazon packed this hard drive in a huge box with nothing inside but a heavy, metal, tub accessory. So, I am sure this delicate electronic had a nice, bumpy, jostled, and fun-filled journey. At least we can hope the package was gently placed on the porch. The picture seems to point to that. That is positive and not normally the case when that dark blue van pulls up. Buy electronics from Amazon they said...hmmm.... Best Buy, thanks for welcoming me back into the fold. I apologize for ever doubting you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed twice
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed earlier this year, and it was due to the power supply failing. Got a replacement RMA, and used the power supply from the new device. Now the drive has failed completely, and WD will not replace the drive itself, since already had service for the power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Demers

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Storage...
customer_reviews.text: I connected it to my Macbook Pro and and transferred 4gb from another drive to it which took most of the day. When I went to X'fer another external drives data to it, my original 4gb data was missing. I used the WD utility to check the drive and it did not complete. I disconnected it from my Mac and reconnected it. My Mac never saw it again! My Mac would not recognize it was connected even though the WD Utility said it was connected. With that, I moved it over to my Thinkpad C1 and it has been working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Skyman

customer_reviews.title: Comes pre-formatted to exFAT.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but was surprised to find that the disk comes pre-formatted as exFAT rather than the NTFS I expected and would rather have. I found that loading about 5 TB of movie files went much faster after re-formatting to NTFS. I know that exFAT is more likely to be supported by a wide range of products, but that is not important to me. Win 10 and my Panasonic TV both support NTFS and that is all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Denny

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE  HARD DRIVE BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I use WD hard drives all the time and they are usually good but i decided to try this model out and wow what a mistake. Hard drive is slower than dial up internet and sometimes it doesnt even mount to the desk top when i open it. If you dont mind incredibly slow read and write speeds then have at it but youll regret it.
customer_reviews.author: PB77

customer_reviews.title: Great storage for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One as a media storage drive, and another as a backup. They arrived in great shape, and are working as intended. By default, they come with EXFAT formatting (likely for compatibility with Windows, Apple, and Linux OSes including USB plugs for home routers/clouds. I reformatted to NTFS for my needs, and I used the WD tool to set the sleep timer to 90 minutes to better suit my media-playing/storing needs. I think the default is only 30 minutes for drive spin-down/sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Ramze

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk and a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: First Drive failed after 24 hours. Windows 10 would not recognize or repair. Ran WD utilities which took 23 hours and still windows would not recognize. Returned for replacement. With new drive, attempted to make my first backup using the WD Backup feature. After 16 hours it was only 1% done. I only gave it 185GB to backup - what the hell is it doing? Windows backup does not work with this unit. Not worth wasting time with.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Software doesn't work on new Win 10 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Drive is working ok but the software does not work, after multiple troubleshooting session with WD support they told me the software would not work on my new HP Omen laptop running Win 10 operating system. Frustrated, I am using Win 10 back-up software with the drive. Start-up time for drive is slow, once it is running transfer speed is good, seems to work fine. I only bought this because I didn't want to use Win 10 back-up and that's what I have to do now. Not happy about it and disappointed in the WD support. The accents of several of the tech support people was such that I had to ask them to repeat things 2 to 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: Sloane Schrodinger

customer_reviews.title: Software failed to install
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great put of the box with no complaints besides the fact that i has an issue installing the included software. I probably would not have used or anyway and it may be something to do with my windows installation but the software kept causing my computer to freeze everyone i tried to install it. I will try to install on a fresh version of Windows and update when i get a chance. Besides that the speeds are satisfactory And i May open it up and see what drive is actually installed like others already have.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Pearson

customer_reviews.title: using for xbox one
customer_reviews.text: using this for my external xbox one hard drive and it works great, just hook up power plug it in the usb 3.0 port and format for apps and games and then you can move all your games off the main drive to this and you'll have tons more space to work with, you really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Kreamer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work with my  readyshare On my network via wifi.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this. Love this brand. Love the storage. Hate that it won’t work right with my computers when I hook it to my router and try to connect. It keeps asking me for my admin password and then that doesn’t work. I bought this to connect to my network and it won’t. I still like that it holds all my stuff. It just sucks that I have to get it out, boot it up and plug it into my laptop every time I want to use it. This isn’t a deal breaker... just makes me not happy and won’t give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chad H.

customer_reviews.title: I've always loved Western Digital products
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Western Digital products. This external drive is no exception either. I am a Landscape Photographer and just one image could easily be between 50 to 70 megabytes. The 8TB drive gives lots of space for storage, and the hardware is reliable and secure. My one regret is WD did not spend much effort on the backup software. I find their software leaves a lot to be desired. I have my own system for triple backups of all my work. It is a manual process and a bit of a pain, but it's foolproof.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Cantelmo

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good drive
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive as a backup for my Mac. The drive is a definitely a good value and it works well. I initially had a problem where daily Time Machine (Mac backup) could not find the drive. I did some research and found I needed to remove all of the Western Digital utility programs I had installed. It was no big deal for me since I found I really didn't need those utilities anyway. If you are looking for a good backup solution at an excellent price, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: schackbo

customer_reviews.title: So far this drive does not dissapoint
customer_reviews.text: This drive could not be easier to use and seems to work just as fast if not faster than my other My Book drives. Simply plug it in and within about a minute it's ready to go already formatted at full capacity. While it's running it does make an occasional rattling noise but is otherwise generally quiet. One warning, if you have already decided that you don't like the exFAT format and want to reformat to NTFS, make sure you copy the software that is resident on the drive unless you just don't want it.
customer_reviews.author: Fox Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Lost All My Data.
customer_reviews.text: Took me upload 50 Gigs of pics from family and after moving the drive to another room to another computer, it is all corrupted data and tech support says I need to reformat and all my data is lost. Seriously? It's 2019 and WD has not gotten it together to have a reliable product? Will never use another WD product ever. BUYERS BE WARNED. ONLY BUY IF YOU CAN AFFORD LOSING ALL YOUR DATA WITH A SIMPLE DISCONNECTION OF THE DRIVE TO MOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Beni

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK... CAN'T RETURN IT NOW AND REALLY NEEDED IT
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in, the fan came on for a split second and it never did anything else. Doesn't work, and I needed it badly to backup work files. I surely am not going anywhere to return it! We're under stay at home law! What am I supposed to do now??? I can't loose $600!! My business has been closed a week already!!!
customer_reviews.author: amanda charbonnet

customer_reviews.title: Love it, recommended.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We purchased this to expand the memory of our PS4 Pro and it works perfectly. This listing used to state it were exfat and now I am not seeing that in the description. Either way it formatted in mere moments and worked great from then on. Our games save directly to the PS4 itself, while actual games and updates are on this external hard drive. No, you still need the discs to play, for anyone wondering, but our reason for purchase was to be able to fit the games we own and their updates. PS4 just does not have enough memory on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Beaudette Family

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 8 months. Can't find how to get fixed under warra ty
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 and liked them One has quit getting recognized by any computer. Need to return it under warranty but cannot find how. Added comment. Contacted Western Digital and am going to send back the them for repair/replacement. I have to pay shipping. My shipping rate, I beleive from past return shipping in general, it more codtly than theirs. WD will pay to ship back to me. This is only the first hard drive I've ever had fail in almost 30 years of using PCs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Power
customer_reviews.text: I don't even use half a TB and don't have videos or games or tons of photos. I just bought it to back up my old Macbook Pro as it was sluggish and worried me. It's my first external HD. I am working with the manufacturer so we shall see, but sending back a hard drive with all my personal date is foolish. Since it won't even turn on, I cannot wipe it. I cannot transfer between my new mac and my old until I can back up the old...just in case. So very annoying. Week three.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, reliable, fast...
customer_reviews.text: I use this HD connected to my NAS USB port to quicksync very important data as an additional backup. You can’t be to careful. I can’t even tell the drive is on its so quiet. I have to hold it up to my ear to tell if it’s running. I would easily purchase this external drive again, actually thinking of purchasing a second one for additional storage using the second USB port. Before attaching to my NAS I was able to get write speeds in excess of 200mbps from my MacBook Pro. Next to my SSD it’s the fastest drive I have.
customer_reviews.author: Don Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Never been this disappointed,
customer_reviews.text: These days I am used to plugging USB drives and 'playing'. Not with this one. The power cable didn't work. I tried another, it couldn't copy a single file. I bought this as used, may that is why this item was returned. It is unusable. I don't know whether to blame Western Digital or Amazon. To sell a product as used which is not usable is simply immoral!
customer_reviews.author: Novan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With Xbox One.
customer_reviews.text: Using it with Xbox One without any issues, just know that it requires a power supply, it doesn't draw energy from the console's USB port, of course the AC plug is included. The console will detect the hard drive and ask you to format it, then you can save game installs, saves, run games from it, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Freakonforfatty

customer_reviews.title: OK 8TB external HDD
customer_reviews.text: Always like the WD reliability and have accumulated quite a few over the years. This one is a bit different though and I'm taking off a few stars for: 1. I had to disable USB boot in the system Bios because this drive would cause the system to hang at boot up (this is the only external HDD to cause this behavior) 2. Seems to be a little slow on spin up. and 3. A little bit noisier than others. But, if on sale, it would be a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: DOA drive from third party to New HD from WD
customer_reviews.text: Never got to see the drive in Windows 10. Could not initiate. Would not format. Used WD software to examine drive, errors corrupted drive and sectors damaged by 2 tests. Contacted third party seller, required $26 shipping return. Called WD for replacement. Next one should work, never had a problem with WD drives before. UPDATE 1/19/2020: Rec'd replacement Ext HD from WD, worked right from the start up. Transferred files with no problem. Glad WD stands behind their product. Total cost was ship only $11.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT. S

customer_reviews.title: MAC users take note: not "plug and play."
customer_reviews.text: Once it got set up it is fine. But... If you are formatting this for a MAC, you must get help. It comes with no directions and even the online .pdf owners manual was no help. I was ready to send it back - glad I didn't. I'm a pretty savvy computer guy but had to call WD. They were there and walked me through the process. The drive has to be erased reformatted for MAC OS. This takes a bit of doing with assistance from a real WD person on the support line. I'm a big fan of WD external drives, but if you want "plug and play" for your mac don't count on it.
customer_reviews.author: Fussy Guy Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Good but Loud
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the loudest hard drive I've ever owned. The fans turn on, get louder, then louder, then LOUDER and you think he hard drive is going to explode. It also has a cheap plastic outer which keeps the price down but makes it very fragile. Don’t set it down too hard on your desk. It serves it’s purpose at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: SETH

customer_reviews.title: 8TB would be great if mine worked
customer_reviews.text: 8TB would be great if mine worked! So, right out of the box and the HD ramps up its spin making a loud metal on metal sound. If mine did not even survive long enough to plug it in, how well would it last if it had worked? Want your files to be lost and not recoverable? Take the risk and buy this! Lol...nope. Returned for credit and never buying WD again.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Colvin

customer_reviews.title: WD Backup program quit working
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for several months. Suddenly the WD Backup program stopped working. I deleted the program, downloaded the current version from WD's website, and loaded the program. Still no sign of it. If there is no way to automatically back up the drive, it is practically useless. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MusicHound

customer_reviews.title: excellent, but reformat if using with your TV
customer_reviews.text: As always, an excellent drive (my 16th WD in 12 years with no failures so far). Works precisely as advertised with an extra years warranty over previous models. One Warning, This drive has been formatted as ReFS; although it shows as exFAT. If you are using this drive with a PC this will not matter (although files on an ReFS drive take more space than files on an NTFS drive. IF you want to use this drive as a media server connected to your TV, MAKE SURE YOU REFORMAT THIS DRIVE TO to NTFS. exFAT did not work with my SAMSUNG TV.
customer_reviews.author: Lethal

customer_reviews.title: Quiet. Fast.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my Xbox One. All of my games, apps, and media are on this thing. Load times are noticeably faster. Its very quiet. You can't tell that it's on. I never turn it off and I've noticed that it goes to sleep at some point after you stop using it. Like I'll be playing Minecraft, pause it and take a break, come back in an hour or three and start to play again and it will take a few seconds before the game resumes. Less than 10 seconds. I guess that's better than the dive running nonstop and wearing out a lot sooner.
customer_reviews.author: VG Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Bad Software
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive works, but don't bother installing the software. I could never get it to work, and I've been building computers for over 30 years. I tried scheduling backups and also just backing up immediately, but even after an over 8 hour wait progress never got past 0%. I tried tech support, and the only thing I got was a message that the software didn't work with Windows 10, so I just used Windows Backup and Restore (Windows 7). It works with Windows 10. You can access it through Windows 10 Settings. A 1.5 TB backup completed in a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T work out of the box!!  In fact, doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4TB drive My Book and was trouble from the start. Virtually no direction, first ONE backup ate up all the back-up space then couldn't get it to backup at all - went through at least 3-4 times with customer support, tech support, chats, emails. After over a month they determined it was defective and said they would send me an RMA number in an email to return for a replacement. The email came with NO RMA and apparently have to call customer support AGAIN to obtain an RMA, Would like to turn this in for a refund and invest in something that actually works. Have used 2-3 other brand external drives with NO such problems.
customer_reviews.author: R. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Case rattles & buzzes
customer_reviews.text: I have the 8TB single drive and am returning it. When there is a continuous drive activity, such as reading or writing large files, the case rattles & buzzes. This is extremely annoying and distracting, since drive is placed on my desk. Sure, you can stop the buzzing by squeezing the case but hardly practical, no? I also have an older 6TB model MyBook and it is fine -- no rattles, and overall the older drive is virtually silent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: A little strange
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought the 6TB drive to replace on older back up drive that was full and I didn't want to erase.... I could have sworn this was Dead On Arrival. No light, No sound, and I thought No action. I called customer support. They said the unit has No light of any sort..no power indicator..nothing. And it makes absolutely no sound whatsoever. Sure enough it was working. There was a folder on my desktop I hadn't noticed. It seems to be working fine. I just wish there was some little light shining at me to give me some positive feedback that it's alive ... nothing
customer_reviews.author: thorn3686

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: This drive is reasonably quick for its size and has enough storage space to meet most home needs. One catch is that this storage was too big to hang off my Netgear router so if you are planning on connecting to a router be sure to check the maximum storage supported on the routers USB port.
customer_reviews.author: T. Runyan

customer_reviews.title: If you have an iMac or macbook, please buy the specific model for that brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and am not technically savvy at all so I can see it's backing up my stuff but that's about all I can do with it. Don't think it's a product issue but rather user error! But if I had bought the mac version of this product I'm sure I'd be having no trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: Peggie666

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an archive drive
customer_reviews.text: I have a NAS that I use for many various things, and even though I have it set up for 2 drive failures before I lose my data I figured I'd pick up one external drive to only turn on and run when I do an archive of crucial data, then go back to sleep preventing it from wearing out over time. This little drive is much faster than expected! USB3 is really solid, and I love it! I haven't had an external drive in years, so I remember the days of the super large 500GB drives crawling to copy over a 10GB file. HA!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Kish

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem deciding if I wanted to try this model because of the negative reviews. But I found similar reviews on all comparable models. I hooked it up , restarted my PC , Windows 10 found the device , I ran a complete backup with 1'000's of photos and as many CD's , it ran flawless , I can barely hear it running , It is a good device ' simple and well made , and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Horse

customer_reviews.title: Drive did not work on arrival, I believe I ...
customer_reviews.text: Drive did not work on arrival, I believe I had a defective drive but it's worth mentioning as this is the first time I have received a dead WD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Disk started to fail after 1 year and 8 months of use
customer_reviews.text: If you care for your data, don't buy this product. I lost a ton of data. Files wouldnt open and the disk had tons of errors. After a full format still caused issues and again data was lost. Had this since 2018. The issues start suddenly and is all down-hill from there. Stay away from this product if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Good But Loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought these drives for home media storage. They work great so far (about one month). I have them set up in a RAID 0 configuration on a Windows Storage Pool so my use case is probably a little unique. I had read other reviews mentioning how loud these drives were and I thought, "Eh, how loud could they be?" And boy, they are loud. Loud enough for wife aggro. I had to place some foam underneath them to dampen the thumping noise they make in my media center.
customer_reviews.author: Sakura

customer_reviews.title: Not much better than the MyPassport drive for most people, but it's exactly what I needed and at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than its MyPassport brethren, and it needs its own power. That said, it's fast, it's efficient, it has a lot of room, and it works exactly as it should. Also, because it's encrypted and keyed to the case, if it ever gets removed from the case it's useless. This is a decent security feature to have, but it can become an issue if you ever want to pull out the drive and just put it in your system. I'm using it right now for my database, but before I installed it on my PC I checked it out on my Xbox One. Works very well there as a plug-and-play device, if you're wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Johnboy69

customer_reviews.title: Not too user friendly
customer_reviews.text: If I were a computer whiz then perhaps I would like this unit but it required formatting for use with my Macbook and I didn't have the time or ability to mess with it. I just want something simple that I can store pictures, movies and documents on that will be easily retrievable when needed so this wasn't the model for me.
customer_reviews.author: Megifog

customer_reviews.title: A bit noisy, but it works
customer_reviews.text: First unit DOA, so -1 star; replacement was quick and straightforward, no hassles there. Drive makes periodic thumping sounds and makes a continuous low rumble that can be felt in my desk at all times (-1 star), but has thus far functioned just fine. It's not as quiet or smooth as I might like, but it should do the job. We'll see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Be aware that it comes with MANDATORY arbitration in case of disputes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to cloud storage, but am not happy with the current trend of customers being forced to lose the right to jury trials in the case of serious loss or damage to themselves that might be caused by products they buy. I guess I need to use both cloud and device backups "just in case".
customer_reviews.author: Lightseeker
